identificationModule.briefTitle: Potassium Containing Salt-Substitute in Hemodialysis-Dependent End Stage Kidney Disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Pilot, Double-Blind Crossover Trial of a Potassium Containing Salt-Substitute in Hemodialysis-Dependent End Stage Kidney Disease

descriptionModule.briefSummary: 16 individuals with hemodialysis-dependent end stage kidney disease will receive 16 days of a potassium-containing salt-substitute and 16 days of standard table salt in random order. There will be a 19 day wash out period between the salt-substitute and table salt periods. Potassium concentration will be measured bi-weekly prior to HD each week during intervention. The primary endpoint will be the change in potassium from baseline. Additional measurements will include assessment of dietary intake, ambulatory blood pressure, occurrence of peri-dialytic symptoms, and per-dialytic vital signs.

armGroups.label: Standard Table Salt, then Salt Substitute
armGroups.description:
The two intervention periods will last 16 days with a 19-day washout period in between.

During the first 16-day treatment period, participants will receive the Standard Table Salt to use for cooking and as an additive at the table. Participants will then undergo a 19-day washout period. The second 16-day treatment period will immediately follow the washout period. During the second 16-day treatment period, participants will receive the Salt Substitute to use for cooking and as an additive at the table.

Participants will be encouraged to replace their use of regular salt with the Standard Table Salt and Salt Substitute. They will be encouraged to reduce their overall intake of salt throughout the study period. There are no restrictions or further instructions regarding timing or dosing.

In addition, participants will undergo standard of care hemodialysis (typically 3x/week) and have their blood chemistries measured according to the usual standard of care during the study.

armGroups.label: Salt Substitute, then Standard Table Salt
armGroups.description:
The two intervention periods will last 16 days with a 19-day washout period in between.

During the first 16-day treatment period, participants will receive the Salt Substitute to use for cooking and as an additive at the table. Participants will then undergo a 19-day washout period. The second 16-day treatment period will immediately follow the washout period. During the second 16-day treatment period, participants will receive the Standard Table Salt to use for cooking and as an additive at the table.

Participants will be encouraged to replace their use of regular salt with the Standard Table Salt and Salt Substitute. They will be encouraged to reduce their overall intake of salt throughout the study period. There are no restrictions or further instructions regarding timing or dosing.

In addition, participants will undergo standard of care hemodialysis (typically 3x/week) and have their blood chemistries measured according to the usual standard of care during the study.

interventions.name: Standard Table Salt
interventions.description: Standard Table Salt is administered orally. It is transferred to unmarked saltshakers by non-blinded research coordinators. The unmarked saltshaker is delivered to the participant during dialysis.
armGroupLabels: Salt Substitute, then Standard Table Salt
Standard Table Salt, then Salt Substitute

interventions.name: Salt Substitute
interventions.description:
Salt Substitute is available as a crystalized powder. It substitutes potassium chloride for sodium chloride, and thus contains about 50% less sodium than standard table salt.

Salt Substitute is administered orally. It is transferred to unmarked saltshakers by non-blinded research coordinators. The unmarked saltshaker is delivered to the participant during dialysis.
armGroupLabels: Salt Substitute, then Standard Table Salt
Standard Table Salt, then Salt Substitute

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Serum Potassium Concentration During First Treatment Period
primaryOutcomes.description: Serum potassium concentration expressed in milliequivalents per liter (mEq/L).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Serum Potassium Concentration During Second Treatment Period
primaryOutcomes.description: Serum potassium concentration expressed in mEq/L.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Presenting with Severe Hyperkalemia During First Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Severe hyperkalemia defined as pre-dialysis potassium levels greater than 6.5 mEq/L. The first treatment period spans from Day 1 to Day 16.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Presenting with Severe Hyperkalemia During Second Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Severe hyperkalemia defined as pre-dialysis potassium levels greater than 6.5 mEq/L. The second treatment period spans from Day 36 to Day 52.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Presenting with Moderate Hyperkalemia
secondaryOutcomes.description: Moderate hyperkalemia defined as pre-dialysis potassium levels greater than 6.0 mEq/L and less than 6.5 mEq/L.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Potassium Concentration During First Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Potassium concentration expressed in mEq/L. The first treatment period spans from Day 1 to Day 16.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Potassium Concentration During Second Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Potassium concentration expressed in mEq/L. The second treatment period spans from Day 36 to Day 52.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure During First Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ambulatory systolic blood pressure expressed in millimeters of mercury (mm Hg).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure During Second Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ambulatory systolic blood pressure expressed in mm Hg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Pre-Dialysis Systolic Blood Pressure During First Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pre-dialysis systolic blood pressure expressed in mm Hg. The first treatment period spans from Day 1 to Day 16.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Pre-Dialysis Systolic Blood Pressure During Second Treatment Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pre-dialysis systolic blood pressure expressed in mm Hg. The second treatment period spans from Day 36 to Day 52.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Presenting with Intradialytic Hypotension
secondaryOutcomes.description: Intradialytic hypotension defined as a systolic blood pressure of less than 100 mmHg or a systolic blood pressure decrease of greater than 10 mmHg, or a mean arterial pressure decrease of greater than 30 mmHg with or without symptoms.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Receiving outpatient maintenance HD therapy.
2. Age ≥ 21 years.
3. Negative serum pregnancy test for women of child-bearing capacity. Childbearing capacity will be defined by report of menstruation within ≤ 6 months.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Currently incarcerated.
2. Insufficient capacity for informed consent.
3. Non-hemolyzed serum potassium concentration \>6.0 mEq/L within ≤30 days.
4. Unscheduled HD for hyperkalemia within ≤30 days.
5. Attendance at ≤10 of last 13 scheduled OP HD sessions.
6. Co-habiting family member with known hyperkalemia.
7. Co-habiting family with ≥stage 3b chronic kidney disease or chronic kidney disease of unknown severity.
8. Hemoglobin \< 8.0 mg/dL.
9. Use of other potassium supplements.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: All of the individual participant data collected during the trial, after deidentification, will be shared upon reasonable request beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication or as required by a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research provided the investigator who proposes to use the data executes a data use agreement with NYU Langone Health. Requests may be directed to: David Charytan, MD MSc (David.charytan@Nyulangone.org). The protocol will be made available on Clinicaltrials.gov only as required by federal regulation or as a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication or as required by a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: The investigator who proposed to use the data will be granted access upon reasonable request. Requests should be directed to David.charytan@Nyulangone.org. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement.
